title: Fivestar4everMVP
author: Fivestar4everMVP
content: First, I wish to let us all know that this thread is supposed to be in the scam and accusation board, but I decided to post it here since the scam is mainly targeting gamblers and Rollbit users most especially... Someone is impersonating Rollbit Razer, the scammer by the username RazerR, signed up on bitcointalk today, and immediately after signing up, started THIS THREAD claiming Rollbit is airdropping their token(RLB) to users..To claim the airdrop, you have to visit a website I don't want to mention here..And connect your wallet....The scammer after posting this thread immediately locked the thread so no one would be able to comment,PLEASE STAY AWAY, THIS IS SCAM, DO NOT CONNECT YOUR WALLET.. And also tag the scammer so that he will be banned, scammer btt profile linked to his username I mentioned above...

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I saw the notification but didn't bother to check the thread.According to whois the site was created few hours agoCode:Domain:rlbcoin.comRegistrar:Hostinger, UABRegistered On:2023-07-15Expires On:2024-07-15Updated On:2023-07-15Status:clientTransferProhibitedName Servers:ns1.siteground.netns2.siteground.nethttps://www.whois.com/whois/rlbcoin.comI guess there were trying to use the popularity of Rollbit to get the attention of bitcointalkers. I went tos ite and it seems you can't remove the popup message unless you conncet your wallet as you said.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.created_time: July 15, 2023, 02:51:18 PMLast edit: July 15, 2023, 03:04:08 PM by Oshosondy
comments.body: I too have reported the site. Let us hope Cyrus, hilariousandco or any other moderator will remove the thread very soon. The O created the thread and lock it which is a good means to know that it is a scam. The domian name was just created not long ago which is a way to finally know that it is a scam attempt.Edit: the thread has been nuked.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5459912.new#new

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on July 15, 2023, 02:46:23 PMI guess there were trying to use the popularity of Rollbit to get the attention of bitcointalkers. I went tos ite and it seems you can't remove the popup message unless you conncet your wallet as you said.the dude's a moron, what was he thinking posting an extremely obvious scam on a forum that deals with scams on a daily basis. anyway, left him a negative tag too, although I doubt he'll be banned from posting a scam and getting a lot of negative tags(I'll be surprised if he did). Right now, his thread has been deleted, as Oshosondy has mentioned.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: This scammer may not know this forum well, which is why he posted this scam here. Where scammers are exposed every day, and he has posted a scam that is easily assumed to be a scam. However, since he posted this scam here it means that he will now use this technique to try to scam crypto users in different ways. They want to get access to wallets of crypto users by creating fake airdrop websites using popular website names. OP thank you for bringing this scam forward, hope newbies will be careful after reading this thread.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: ScamViruS on July 15, 2023, 03:52:11 PMThis scammer may not know this forum well, which is why he posted this scam here. Where scammers are exposed every day, and he has posted a scam that is easily assumed to be a scam. However, since he posted this scam here it means that he will now use this technique to try to scam crypto users in different ways. They want to get access to wallets of crypto users by creating fake airdrop websites using popular website names. OP thank you for bringing this scam forward, hope newbies will be careful after reading this thread.Yeah, the most vulnerable are the newbies who might not have the slightest idea that this is a scam, I hope they will come across this thread, and not only avoid falling prey to this bad eggs, but also stay vigilant and get immunization against future and similar scam strategies..The idea of scamming unsuspecting victims through fake airdrops is  a very popular strategy which I personally assume that by now, every body should be familiar with, but for the sake of new people joining this space, we must not stop warning when the need arises.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on July 15, 2023, 05:57:29 PMQuote from: ScamViruS on July 15, 2023, 03:52:11 PMThis scammer may not know this forum well, which is why he posted this scam here. Where scammers are exposed every day, and he has posted a scam that is easily assumed to be a scam. However, since he posted this scam here it means that he will now use this technique to try to scam crypto users in different ways. They want to get access to wallets of crypto users by creating fake airdrop websites using popular website names. OP thank you for bringing this scam forward, hope newbies will be careful after reading this thread.Yeah, the most vulnerable are the newbies who might not have the slightest idea that this is a scam, I hope they will come across this thread, and not only avoid falling prey to this bad eggs, but also stay vigilant and get immunization against future and similar scam strategies..My fear for newbies is that when they see something free, they run blindly after it, causing them to fall badly into scams and lose their money. These scams are still brought to the market by scammers because they know that the crypto market is flooded with newbies every day and it is easy to trap them. Newbies should join this forum as soon as they get involved in the crypto market, because this forum is such a source of knowledge about crypto currency that one who spends some time on this forum will not fall prey to scammers easily. So if newbies are smart and clever, scammers' plans also tend to fail.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on July 15, 2023, 05:57:29 PMYeah, the most vulnerable are the newbies who might not have the slightest idea that this is a scam, I hope they will come across this thread, and not only avoid falling prey to this bad eggs, but also stay vigilant and get immunization against future and similar scam strategies..The idea of scamming unsuspecting victims through fake airdrops is  a very popular strategy which I personally assume that by now, every body should be familiar with, but for the sake of new people joining this space, we must not stop warning when the need arises. Despite the fact that these strategies have become popular, you find that there are beginners who still do not know them. Every day, thousands enter the crypto market, especially those who register in the forum. It is possible that they lack knowledge and experience; perhaps if they encounter a simple phishing site like this, they will not know the distinction between it and the official domain of the Rollbit platform, and they will be confused and end up losing their wallets and getting a bad impression, so publishing these warnings and their top ranking in search engines, and reporting scam topics and these phishing sites will be a good thing for them. Thank you, OP.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Usually I got surprised seeing that Rollbit is running an airdrop without it being announced by them or is there anything special, like due to how I was being conscious to click some link I never pay attention to open the site and view what's inside and how claim airdrop. From some of the information I often got from here made me to understand that some of the airdrops are basically to lure participants into swipe their wallet and it's very rare to have a legitimate airdrops that would rewards their participants handsomely.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on July 15, 2023, 02:41:25 PMTo claim the airdrop, you have to visit a website I don't want to mention here..@Fivestar4everMVP, this is a real warning to anyone about the RLBcoin Airdrop, nowadays there are many ways that scammers want to do, for example like what @RazerR did, he is a real fraud. fortunately their thread has been deleted, if not, God knows how many victims have been deceived.We have long seen disputes about RLBcoin Airdrop, done by fraudsters, as I have seen in: www.reddit.com, the last few decades.QuoteI see tons of people on reddit and discord warning about the RLB airdrop (Rollbit coin) being a wallet drain scam. Is there anyone who got their wallet drained?I did some digging and I can't find anyone who actually got their wallet drained first hand. To me it just seems like people are spreading misinformation due to the nature of the airdrop. Yes, it is sketchy but nothing about the coin or website seems malicious.Usually, whatever the official rollbitcom team does, they always inform in advance on social media such as: Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and so on.But I didn't find anything about the official RLB airdrop on their Twitter: https://twitter.com/rollbitcomMy advice, anyone interested in Airdrop is more careful, don't rush to access their web on behalf of tokens belonging to other companies, look for as much information as possible about their authenticity whether they are official or fraudulent.I hope this serves as a stark warning to those seeking an airdrop of any type of token.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: The scammers still continue to try to clone popular sites and try to rob money in this way, but for us to be aware and fast to report it and have deleted it even though I see the clone site is still in access, I am afraid the scammers are trying to spread outside the forum.This is almost the same as the case before with Bitcasino which was cloned but they did not spread it here but on telegram by trying to give 500 USDT to claim the code, but we must be aware that clone sites are now widely spread.I would like to know if this site (https://rollbot.com/) is a mirror of rollbit.com? Although there are pop-ups notifying to visit to rollbit.com.
